notes.text:
An update for firefox is now available for Red Hat Enterprise Linux 7.

Red Hat Product Security has rated this update as having a security impact of Important. A Common Vulnerability Scoring System (CVSS) base score, which gives a detailed severity rating, is available for each vulnerability from the CVE link(s) in the References section.
notes.title: Topic

notes.text:
Mozilla Firefox is an open-source web browser, designed for standards compliance, performance, and portability.

This update upgrades Firefox to version 68.10.0 ESR.

Security Fix(es):

* Mozilla: Memory corruption due to missing sign-extension for ValueTags on ARM64 (CVE-2020-12417)

* Mozilla: Information disclosure due to manipulated URL object (CVE-2020-12418)

* Mozilla: Use-after-free in nsGlobalWindowInner (CVE-2020-12419)

* Mozilla: Use-After-Free when trying to connect to a STUN server (CVE-2020-12420)

* Mozilla: Add-On updates did not respect the same certificate trust rules as software updates (CVE-2020-12421)

For more details about the security issue(s), including the impact, a CVSS score, acknowledgments, and other related information, refer to the CVE page(s) listed in the References section.
notes.title: Details

cwe.name: Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

Due to confusion about ValueTags on JavaScript Objects, an object may pass through the type barrier, resulting in memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Memory corruption due to missing sign-extension for ValueTags on ARM64
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#1853014: CVE-2020-12417 Mozilla: Memory corruption due to missing sign-extension for ValueTags on ARM64

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2020-12417 Mozilla: Memory corruption due to missing sign-extension for ValueTags on ARM64

cwe.name: Exposure of Sensitive Information to an Unauthorized Actor

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

Manipulating individual parts of a URL object could have caused an out-of-bounds read, leaking process memory to malicious JavaScript.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Information disclosure due to manipulated URL object
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#1853015: CVE-2020-12418 Mozilla: Information disclosure due to manipulated URL object

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2020-12418 Mozilla: Information disclosure due to manipulated URL object

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

When processing callbacks that occurred during window flushing in the parent process, the associated window may die; causing a use-after-free condition. This could have led to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

references.summary: bz#1853016: CVE-2020-12419 Mozilla: Use-after-free in nsGlobalWindowInner

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

When trying to connect to a STUN server, a race condition could have caused a use-after-free of a pointer, leading to memory corruption and a potentially exploitable crash.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Use-After-Free when trying to connect to a STUN server
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#1853017: CVE-2020-12420 Mozilla: Use-After-Free when trying to connect to a STUN server

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2020-12420 Mozilla: Use-After-Free when trying to connect to a STUN server

cwe.name: Improper Following of a Certificate's Chain of Trust

notes.text: The CVSS score(s) listed for this vulnerability do not reflect the associated product's status, and are included for informational purposes to better understand the severity of this vulnerability.
notes.title: CVSS score applicability

notes.text:
The Mozilla Foundation Security Advisory describes this flaw as:

When performing add-on updates, certificate chains terminating in non-built-in-roots were rejected (even if they were legitimately added by an administrator.) This could have caused add-ons to become out-of-date silently without notification to the user.
notes.title: Vulnerability description

notes.text: Mozilla: Add-On updates did not respect the same certificate trust rules as software updates
notes.title: Vulnerability summary

references.summary: bz#1853018: CVE-2020-12421 Mozilla: Add-On updates did not respect the same certificate trust rules as software updates

remediations.details:
For details on how to apply this update, which includes the changes described in this advisory, refer to:

https://access.redhat.com/articles/11258

After installing the update, Firefox must be restarted for the changes to take effect.

vulnerabilities.title: CVE-2020-12421 Mozilla: Add-On updates did not respect the same certificate trust rules as software updates
